Curious baby 
 elephant 
 
 Judith Baker and Lorato Trok 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Everyone knows that the 
 
 elephant has a very long 
 
 nose. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But a long time ago, the 
 
 elephant’s nose was short 
 
 and fat. Like a shoe in the 
 
 midle of his face. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A curious baby elephant 
 
 was born. She had a 
 
 question for every animal. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She was curious about 
 
 Girafe. 
 
 “Why do you have a long 
 
 neck?” she asked. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She was curious about 
 
 Rhino. 
 
 “Why does your horn have 
 
 a sharp point?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She was curious about 
 
 Hipo. 
 
 “Why do you have red 
 
 eyes?” she asked. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And she was VERY curious 
 
 about Crocodile. 
 
 “What does Crocodile eat 
 
 for diner?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Never ask a question like 
 
 that!” said her mother. 
 
 She walked of, frowning. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But clever Crow quickly 
 
 said, “Folow me to the 
 
 river. There you wil se 
 
 what Crocodile eats for 
 
 diner.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So Baby Elephant folowed 
 
 Crow al the way down to 
 
 the river. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She pushed through the 
 
 reds and stod on the 
 
 bank. 
 
 She loked into the water. 
 
 Where was Crocodile? 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Helo,” said a stone near 
 
 the river bank. 
 
 “Helo,” said Baby 
 
 Elephant. 
 
 “Perhaps you can tel me 
 
 what Crocodile eats for 
 
 diner?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Bend down and I wil tel 
 
 you,” said the stone. 
 
 “Lower, lower.” 
 
 
 
 So Baby Elephant bent 
 
 down lower, until… 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Snap!” Her nose was in 
 
 the jaws of Crocodile. 
 
 
 
 “Crocodile wil eat you for 
 
 diner!” squawked Crow. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Baby Elephant sat back on 
 
 her strong legs and puled, 
 
 and puled, and puled. 
 
 
 
 But Crocodile did not let 
 
 go. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Baby Elephant’s nose 
 
 stretched, and stretched, 
 
 and stretched, until… 
 
 
 
 “Duf!” she fel on her 
 
 back. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Cros at losing his diner, 
 
 Crocodile slithered back 
 
 into the water. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 17  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Baby Elephant loked at 
 
 her nose. 
 
 She could not se where it 
 
 ended! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It was so long she could 
 
 pick fruit from high 
 
 branches. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 19  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And shower herself with 
 
 water on a hot day. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 20  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And to this day, al 
 
 elephants have very long 
 
 and useful trunks.
